entry_requirements_raw.A-Level:
Grade D in 2 relevant subjects listed in Schedule A i.e. Applied Information and Communication Technology, Computer Science, Law, Psychology, Sociology, Geography, Economics, Accounting, Pure Mathematics, Mathematics, Mathematics-Further, Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Computing, Business Studies and any other relevant technical subjects..  SPM Credit/O Level Grade C/ UEC Grade B in one mathematics subject
SPM Pass/O Level Grade E (Pass)/UEC Grade C in English Language**
Pass in Portfolio Interview conducted by TAR UMT
entry_requirements_raw.UEC:
Grade B in 5 relevant subjects listed in Schedule A i.e Malay Language, English Language, Chinese Language, History, Geography, Economics, Accounting, Mathematics, Advanced Mathematics, Advanced Mathematics (I) Advanced Mathematics (II), Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Computing and Information Book Technology, Business Studies, Keeping and Accounts and any other relevant technical subjects..  SPM Credit/O Level Grade C/ UEC Grade B in one mathematics subject
SPM Pass/O Level Grade E (Pass)/UEC Grade C in English Language**
Pass in Portfolio Interview conducted by TAR UMT
entry_requirements_raw.Diploma:
Minimum CGPA 2.00 (Diploma in a related field).  SPM Credit/O Level Grade C/ UEC Grade B in one mathematics subject
SPM Pass/O Level Grade E (Pass)/UEC Grade C in English Language**
Pass in Portfolio Interview conducted by TAR UMT
entry_requirements_raw.STPM:
Grade C in 2 relevant subjects listed in Schedule A Geografi, Ekonomi, Perakaunan, Mathematics (M), Mathematics (T), Further Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Information and Communications Technology (ICT), Pengajian Perniagaan, Pengajian Am, Bahasa Melayu, Sejarah and any other relevant technical subjects..  SPM Credit/O Level Grade C/ UEC Grade B in one mathematics subject
SPM Pass/O Level Grade E (Pass)/UEC Grade C in English Language**
Pass in Portfolio Interview conducted by TAR UMT
entry_requirements_raw.Foundation:
Minimum CGPA 2.00.  SPM Credit/O Level Grade C/ UEC Grade B in one mathematics subject
SPM Pass/O Level Grade E (Pass)/UEC Grade C in English Language**
Pass in Portfolio Interview conducted by TAR UMT

A Master's Degree (MQF, Level 7) in Business field or relevant field as accepted by the University Senate; OR Other qualifications equivalent to a Master's Degree that are accepted by the University Senate..  - Note: Candidates registered for master's degree programmes may apply to convert their candidacy to the doctoral degree programmes within one year after candidate registers for master's degree programmes subjected to: 
- having shown competency and capability in conducting research at doctoral degree level 
- rigorous internal assessment by the HEP; and 
- approval by the HEP Senate. 
- HEP may take the graduates of the Malaysian Qualifications Framework (MQF) Bachelor Level 6 for direct entry into the MQF Level 8 Doctoral programme with the following conditions: 
a) The student obtains a first class or equivalent; OR
b) Obtain a Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 3.67 or equivalent from the academic or Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET) programmes; and 
c) Neutral internal assessment by the HEP; and 
d) Obtained approval from the HEP Senate and accepted into the MQF Level 8 Doctoral programme candidacy. Students should show appropriate progress during the candidature.

entry_requirements_raw.Degree:
-A Bachelor's degree or its equivalent, with a minimum CGPA of 2.75, as accepted by the Senate; OR -A Bachelor's degree or its equivalent, with a minimum CGPA of 2.50 and not meeting CGPA of 2.75, can be accepted subject to rigorous internal assessment;OR -A Bachelor's degree or its equivalent, not meeting CGPA of 2.50, can be accepted subject to a minimum of 5 years working experience in a relevant field..  Candidates without a related qualification or working experience in Civil / Materials Engineering, Engineering Technology, Architecture, Built 
Environment, or other related field, must undergo approriate prerequisite courses determined by the Senate of TAR UMT.
A Bachelor's degree with the following conditions:
A bachelor's degree in the field or related fields with first-class (CGPA of 3.67 or higher) or its equivalent from an academic or Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET) programme;
Undergo internal assessment; and
any other requirements set by the Senate of TAR UMT
Bachelor's degree candidates who are registered for master's degree programmes may apply to convert to the doctoral degree programmes subjected to the following conditions: 
within 1 year for full time and within 2 years for part-time candidates;
having shown competency and capability in conducting research at doctoral level through rigorous internal evaluation by TAR UMT; and
approval by the Senate of TAR UMT

entry_requirements_raw.Masters:
-A Master's Degree (MQF, Level 7) in Engineering or Engineering Technology or Engineering Science accepted by the Higher Educational Provider (HEP) Senate; - Other qualifications equivalent to a Master's Degree (MQF, Level 7) in Engineering or Engineering Technology or Engineering Science that are accepted by the HEP Senate..  - Note: Candidates registered for master's degree programmes may apply to convert their candidacy to the doctoral degree programmes within one year after candidate registers for master's degree programmes subjected to: 
- having shown competency and capability in conducting research at doctoral degree level 
- rigorous internal assessment by the HEP; and 
- approval by the HEP Senate. 
- HEP may take the graduates of the Malaysian Qualifications Framework (MQF) Bachelor Level 6 for direct entry into the MQF Level 8 Doctoral programme with the following conditions: 
a) The student obtains a first class or equivalent; OR
b) Obtain a Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 3.67 or equivalent from the academic or Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET) programmes; and 
c) Neutral internal assessment by the HEP; and 
d) Obtained approval from the HEP Senate and accepted into the MQF Level 8 Doctoral programme candidacy. Students should show appropriate progress during the candidature.
